title: How to Update a Yahoo Alias & Change Your Account Nickname

steps.title: Click "Mailboxes" and click Add to add aliases.
steps.content: Click "Mailboxes" and click Add to add aliases. The "Mailboxes" option is in the menu on the left side of the page. The "Add" option is below the "Temporary email addresses" header. To see this option, click the gear icon and select More Settings . You won't see this section if you have a free Yahoo account and if the Plus feature isn't available in your area. You must pay for a Yahoo Mail Pro account to use this feature if you do live in a region where this is available. If you already have a temporary email address and want to create another, you'll need to expand this menu first to see the Add option. Add a nickname for the temporary email account. You'll see an empty field next to "Create a permanent nickname." This can't be changed once you create it. Click Next to continue. Add a keyword and description, then click Save . You can create up to 500 temporary email addresses. You'll see a red triangle icon next to any addresses that are over the limit and existing addresses must be deleted before you can make more. [1] X Research source Create new email aliases online with a computer, but once you have it created, you can send and receive email to the alias using the mobile app.

steps.title: Click the alias and click Delete to get rid of an alias.
steps.content: Click the alias and click Delete to get rid of an alias. Go to More Settings > Mailboxes" and select the email under "Temporary email addresses." Click "Delete" to remove it from your Yahoo account.

steps.title: Click the alias and click Edit to change an alias.
steps.content: Click the alias and click Edit to change an alias. Go to More Settings > Mailboxes" and select the email under "Temporary email addresses." Click "Edit" to change the info, like the keyword used or description.

steps.title: Switch the sender in an email to your alias.
steps.content: Switch the sender in an email to your alias. When you're composing a new email, click the arrow next to your regular email address and choose your temporary email address. Your alias or temporary email address will look like this: nickname-keyword@yahoo.com . So if you don't trust an online retailer, you can give them a temporary email address, like fashionista-trustworthy@yahoo.com .

steps.title: Go to Manage Your Account on Yahoo.
steps.content: Go to Manage Your Account on Yahoo. Click your profile picture or icon and click Manage your account.

steps.title: Click Personal Info.
steps.content: Click Personal Info . It's on the menu along the top of your browser with Overview and Wallet .

steps.title: Click Update personal details.
steps.content: Click Update personal details . This will open a new window.

steps.title: Edit the name in the "Preferred name" field.
steps.content: Edit the name in the "Preferred name" field. What is written here will display on your Yahoo profile as well as appear in comments you make on Yahoo sites, like Yahoo News. Click Save updates when you're done to apply the changes and close the window. If you use special characters that aren't supported, your preferred name might appear weirdly throughout Yahoo.
